contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox French commune |name = Querqueville |image = Querqueville-vue-rade.jpg |caption = Querqueville, vue du cimetière |image coat of arms = Blason ville fr Querqueville (Manche).svg |region = [[Basse-Normandie]] |department = [[Manche (département)|Manche]] |arrondissement = [[Arrondissement of Cherbourg-Octeville|Cherbourg-Octeville]] |canton = [[Canton of Équeurdreville-Hainneville|Équeurdreville-Hainneville]] |INSEE = 50416 |postal code = 50460 |mayor = Jean-Michel Maghe |term = 2008–2014 |intercommunality = [[Communauté urbaine de Cherbourg]] (CUC) |longitude = -1.6939 |latitude = 49.6642 |elevation m = 50 |elevation min m = 0 |elevation max m = 115 |area km2 = 5.56 |population = 5536 |population date = 2006 |demonym = Querquevillais |website = [http://www.ville-querqueville.fr www.ville-querqueville.fr] }} {{Unreferenced|date=July 2009}} [[Image:Querqueville-vue-rade.jpg|thumb|250px|View of Querqueville from the cemetery]] '''Querqueville''' is a [[Communes of France|commune]] in the [[Manche]] [[Departments of France|department]] in north-western [[France]]. The Chapel of Saint Germanus (''Chapelle Saint-Germain'') with its [[trefoil]] floorplan incorporates elements of one of the earliest surviving places of [[Christian]] worship in the [[Cotentin Peninsula]] - perhaps second only to the Gallo-Roman baptistry at [[Port-Bail]]. ==Heraldry== {{Blazon-arms | img1=Blason ville fr Querqueville (Manche).svg | legend1=Arms of Querqueville | text=The arms of Querqueville are [[blazon]]ed :<br />''Gules, a trefoil chapel Or, pierced and open sable, on a chief azure, 3 bees Or.'' }} ==See also== *[[Communes of the Manche department]] {{Manche communes}} [[Category:Communes of Manche]] {{Manche-geo-stub}}
